result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on February 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.
